bug.short_desc: Move inspector to the contrib infrastructure

long_desc.thetext: The inspector has been a great tool back in the days. But with mature developer tools in the browsers, the need of such an inspector tool is shrinking. Therefore, we could move the inspector to the contrib infrastructure to reduce the need of testing / maintaining the component for future releases.

Moved Inspector into a new repo: https://github.com/qooxdoo/Inspector
with b44c97dc80c2343ac8195cccfd73a279b4bfef88
Looking good. An additional idea could be to hots the app as github page to make it accessible.

I much use the inspector when I have complex layouting and I don't see how browser tools can replace it. How can I modify object properties without that ? I think move in contrib means no longer maintained and obsolete in a few qooxdoo versions

(In reply to comment #4) > I much use the inspector when I have complex layouting and I don't see how > browser tools can replace it. How can I modify object properties without that ?
Its good to hear that the inspector is still in use (as it was my bachelor thesis project). ;) I don't think that browser tool can replace all inspector features. But e.g. the console view is quite obsolete with todays developer tools.
> I think move in contrib means no longer maintained and obsolete in a few > qooxdoo versions
It does not mean that we will stop maintaining it totally. But it gives us the freedom of doing it on demand and not along with every single peace we change in the framework. Additionally, this could make it easier for the community to participate and add pull pull requests as it is a separate repo.
Inspector demo is now hosted at http://qooxdoo.github.io/Inspector/?inspect=http%3A%2F%2Fqooxdoo.github.io%2FFeatureConfigEditor%2F%3Fria
